HCI International 2020

19-24 July 2020, AC Bella Sky Hotel and Bella Center

Copenhagen, Denmark

http://2020.hci.international/

The 22nd International Conference on Human-Computer Interaction is
being organized under the auspices of 21 distinguished international
boards. For the list of Affiliated Conferences / Thematic Areas, as
well as the list of topics of each area of HCI International 2020,
which is expected to attract over 2,000 participants from more than 70
countries around the world, please have a look at the Conference
website 
.

 11 October 2019, regular paper proposals (an abstract of 800 words is
required)
 11 October 2019, tutorial proposals (an abstract of 300 words is
required)
 31 January 2020, poster proposals (an abstract of 300 words is
required)
 10 April 2020, student design proposals (an abstract of 300 words and
a video clip are required)
 1 May 2020, demonstrations (an abstract of 300 words is required)

Detailed information about proposal submission

is available. 

The Conference Proceedings

will be published by Springer in a multi-volume set. Papers will
appear in volumes of the Lecture Notes in Computer Science (LNCS) and
Lecture Notes in Artificial Intelligence (LNAI) series. Poster
Extended Abstracts will be published in the form of short papers in
the Communications in Computer and Information Science (CCIS) series.

An award 
will be presented to the best paper of each of the HCII 2020 Thematic
Areas / Affiliated Conferences and for the best poster extended
abstract.

The Program for Student Volunteers

gives full-time university students from around the world the
opportunity to actively participate and contribute to one of the
prestigious conferences in the field of computing and HCI. The
deadline for applications receipt is 31 January 2020.

------------------------------

Conference contact: Program Administration program@hcii2020.org
